brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators hypothesize that the application of 30% xenon as an adjuvant to general
      anesthesia with a target-controlled infusion of propofol is superior to general anesthesia
      with propofol alone with respect to hemodynamic stability.

clinical_study.brief_title: Xenon as an Adjuvant to Propofol Anaesthesia in Patients Undergoing Off-pump Coronary Artery Bypass Graft Surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with coronary artery disease scheduled for elective OPCAB-surgery

          -  patients willing and able to complete the requirements of this study

          -  Ejection fraction >30%

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Lack of informed consent

          -  age < 18 years

          -  COPD GOLD >II

          -  Renal dysfunction defined as serum-creatinine >1.5mg/dl

          -  acute coronary syndrome during the last 24 hours; haemodynamic    instability,
             requirement of inotropic support

          -  single vessel grafting

          -  disabling neuropsychiatric disorders (severe dementia, Alzheimer's disease,
             schizophrenia, depression, low preoperative cognitive state (MMSE at baseline <25),
             history of stroke with residuals, increased intracranial pressure

          -  Hypersensitivity to the study medication

          -  Presumed uncooperativeness or legal incapacity

intervention.description: xenon 30% in oxygen as an adjuvant to propofol target  controlled infusion (target of 0.5-1.5µg/ml)

keyword: Off-pump coronary artery bypass graft surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Xenon as an Adjuvant to Propofol Anaesthesia in Patients Undergoing Off-pump Coronary Artery Bypass Graft Surgery:a Randomised Controlled Trial

oversight_info.authority: Belgium:  Federal Agency for Medicinal & Health Products

primary_outcome.description: Haemodynamic stability as assessed by the individual intraoperative noradrenaline consumption

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Death from any cause, perioperative life-threatening cardiac arrhythmias, perioperative myocardial infarction, requirement of surgical revisions at the coronary vessels, postoperative coronary angioplasty and stroke
secondary_outcome.measure: MACCE (major adverse cardiac and cerebral events)

secondary_outcome.description: cerebrovascular accident not included in MACCE (TIA, reversible ischaemic neurologic deficit)
secondary_outcome.measure: cerebrovascular accident not included in MACCE

secondary_outcome.description: postoperative renal function as assessed by serum creatinine and BUN levels)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 10 days.

secondary_outcome.description: Severity of postoperative critical illness as indicated by the new simplified acute physiology score (SAPS II), SOFA and APACHE-II score
incidence and duration of postoperative delirium assessed with the Confusion Assessment Method (CAM-ICU), to be assessed in combination with the Mini Mental State Examination
secondary_outcome.measure: incidence and duration of postoperative delirium
secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expectged average of 10 days

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of further AE, SAE and SUSAR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 10 days

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
